title: X Factor Olivia Olson says Simon Cowell 'slapped confidence' into her
text:
Good luck for tonight Olivia! (Picture: ITV/Rex)

Olivia Olson almost didn’t make it to The X Factor Celebrity live shows after her first audition – as she admitted she let her ‘nerves’ get the better of her.

The 27-year-old, who rose to fame as Joanna Anderson on the Christmas classic Love Actually has exclusively told Metro.co.uk that she had the ‘confidence slapped’ back into her after Simon Cowell shut her first audition down by telling her ‘it wasn’t great’.

‘I am very excited about the live shows. but after seeing my audition I did let the nerves get to me,’ she explained.

‘I think it slapped the confidence back into me because I wasn’t confident going into it. On the first song that I sang it wasn’t the best representation of my voice and my talent so when Simon was like “it wasn’t great can you do something else?” I was like “oh I really have to show up now”.

‘I was expecting a different reaction from the judges at the time but I also expected myself to do something different than I did, so I think it was fitting.’

Olivia’s first audition didn’t go to plan (Picture: Rex Features)

You may remember Olivia as the little girl from the popular Richard Curtis movie, who belts out All I Want For Christmas in the unconventional school nativity play before she was chased down through Heathrow Airport by lovable stalker Thomas.

However, the 27-year-old has assured us while she won’t be singing Mariah Carey on the show, she doesn’t want to just be known for Love Actually.

You may remember Olivia from this film (Picture: Universal Pictures)

She added: ‘It’s a funny thing because back home it’s not something I have experienced because I am more famous for the animated work I do now.

‘But coming to the UK where it’s such a beloved film I feel like it’s very much the centre of everyone’s focus but I am like “no I have done other things”.

‘I am proud that I was in the movie as it was the start of my career but since I have had the best of both worlds because in my work I can use my singing and acting.

‘I have been out of the limelight I guess, because it’s the characters that are famous and not me.’

Olivia may be used to the ‘sun and heat’ back home, and despite it being rainy and cold in the UK she revealed she feels ‘very comfortable here’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The former actress also admitted that when she met her fellow contestants she ‘didn’t know who a lot of them were’.

‘Being American you don’t get a lot of the television channels that you get over here so a lot of the TV personalities I didn’t know,’ she added.

‘I was going into it blindly a bit. I didn’t know what to expect but it has exceeded whatever expectation I did have.’

Jenny Ryan from The Chase will also be performing on the live shows after she was initially axed by judge Nicole Scherzinger at the auditions – however soon after it was announced they were bringing her back.

Olivia exclaimed that it was completely ‘justified’ that producers brought Jenny back on the show.

She said: ‘I think it was pretty shocking for everyone when she got eliminated but we are happy to have her back because she deserved to go on the live shows.

‘I think it’s such a fair game at this point, the producers picked such a diverse group of contestants, everyone is really talented, I am surprised by the level of talent that turned up at the stage, so I can’t wait to see what everyone brings.’
